intro: Calopsis sparsa, commonly known as the sparse calopsis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, often pale-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are usually opposite and lance-shaped, while its stems are slender and branching. Calopsis sparsa is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
